description: a(0) = 0; a(n) is obtained by incrementing each digit of a(n-1) by 1.
comments: In A061511-A061522, A061746-A061750 when the incremented digit exceeds 9 it is written as a 2-digit string. So 9+1 becomes the 2-digit string 10, etc.a(n+10) is the concatenation of a(n) and a(n-1).
example: Following 43: 4+1 = 5 and 3+1 = 4, hence the next term is 54.
author: _Amarnath Murthy_, May 08 2001
